result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick J Beavers

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrick J Beavers not in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii, as a friend of the court, in court for Derrick J Beavers.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin.
Case in court to address the Justice Point violation report. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court takes no action as to bail. Court vacates the order to show cause hearing.
Pretrial Services Violation Report 11.1.22, filed.
Court RAISES Justice point supervision to a level 5. All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same. Court ordered defendant to provide a drug screen, as soon as possible.

Defendant Derrick J Beavers in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii, as a friend of the court, in court for Derrick J Beavers.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Bail/bond hearing held. Arguments heard as to bail. Court sets cash bail in the amount of $500.00. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Court sets matter for an order to show cause hearing in Branch 29.
Order to show cause hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
signed and filed.
Court REINSTATES Justice Point Supervision at the previous level. All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same.

Defendant Derrick J Beavers in court.  Attorney Travis Schwantes in court for Derrick J Beavers, as a friend of the Court.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant appears. Court cancels the bench warrant. Attorney Schwantes provides an update to the Court regarding the status of appointing counsel for the defendant. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. State requests a bail/bond hearing. Court adjourns the matter for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
signed and filed.

Defendant Derrick J Beavers not in court.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a status conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court takes no action as to bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Pretrial Services Discharge Report 8.24.22, filed.
Pretrial Services Status Report 8.17.22, filed.

Defendant Derrick J Beavers in court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status of Counsel. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court finds cause to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8.12.22, filed.

Defendant Derrick J Beavers in court with attorney Fred Richardson as a friend to the court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. Attorney Richardson informs court that there is a conflict of interest. Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court. Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed. Preliminary hearing adjourned for cause. Case is adjourned for status of counsel to Br 29.  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7.28.22, filed.
Case set for a preliminary hearing on 7/29/22 at 8:30 am. Court is down and unable to hear the matter. Case rescheduled to 7/28/22 at 8:30 am. Parties notified via email, including Justice Point.

Court ordered no contact with DJB (DOB 4/26/20),;
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Derrick J Beavers in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Derrick J Beavers in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Derrick J Beavers appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 1.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
